page.title: 11Farming
page.content: Farmed land bears little relation to farm names as some original farm houses have been sold off and are now inhabited by persons not connected with farming, such as Red House farm, Lower farm no longer exists. The Farmhouse at Rue's farm has been demolished, but a new set of building have recently been erected on the site, to house livestock. The marshes on both sides of the River Deben have been drained enabling intensive farming to be carried out. On the area north of the river in the parish of Ramsholt this year several acres of oil seed rape was grown. Church Farm, Kirton, owner occupied, is a mixed farm. Its main crops are Barley for malting, Wheat for food and Sugar beet which is sent to the Ipswich Sugar factory.Beef cattle and pigs are reared .No Labour employed.
